entry.title: What I'm doing now
entry.summary:
(This is my now page. It tells you what I'm doing at the moment. It also reminds me what I have decided I want to be doing at the moment.)

Reading:

  • Introducing Elixir by Simon St. Laurent and J. Eisenberg (finished)
  • Test-Driven Development with Python, 2nd Edition by Harry J.W. Percival
  • Javacript with Promises by Daniel Parker (finished)
  • + Practical Object-Oriented Design in Ruby by Sandi Metz
  • + How to Design Programs (2nd Edition) by Matthias Felleisen, Robert Bruce Findler, Matthew Flatt and Shriram Krishnamurthi
  • + Algebra DeMYSTiFieD, Second Edition by Rhonda Huettenmueller
    • Trying to slowly get my maths back to the level it once was, and beyond, with the ultimate goal of getting a solid grasp of linear algebra. Next after this will be Foundation Mathematics and then possibly Coding the Matrix or Linear Algebra: Step by Step.

Looking forward to reading:

  • Amazon Web Services in Action by Michael Wittig & Andreas Wittig
  • JavaScript Allongé, the "Six" Edition
  • Developing a Redux Edge by Johannes Lumpe, Karl Purkhardt, Art Muller, Darío Cravero & Ezekiel Chentnik
  • Docker in Action by Jeff Nickoloff
  • RabbitMQ in Depth by Gavin M. Roy
  • How Linux Works by Brian Ward
  • Foundations of Python Network Programming by Brandon Rhodes
  • ZeroMQ by Pieter Hintjens
  • Ansible for DevOps by Jeff Geerling
  • Haskell programming from first principles by Christopher Allen and Julie Moronuki
  • Foundation Mathematics by K.A. Stroud
  • So many books!!!

Studying:

  • UBCx: Software Development MicroMasters on Edx

Working on:

  • Lots of interesting stuff for Cydar, involving things like Django Rest Framework, Celery, Ansible, and AWS
